00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup I2C_Private_Define I2C private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 /* I2C ENI2C mask                                                                                           */
00046 #define CR_ENI2C_SET             ((u32)0x00000008)
00047 #define CR_ENI2C_RESET           ((u32)0xFFFFFFF7)
00048 
00049 /* I2C ENGC mask                                                                                            */
00050 #define CR_ENGC_SET              ((u32)0x00000004)
00051 #define CR_ENGC_RESET            ((u32)0xFFFFFFFB)
00052 
00053 /* I2C AA mask                                                                                              */
00054 #define CR_ACK_SET               ((u32)0x00000001)
00055 #define CR_ACK_RESET             ((u32)0xFFFFFFFE)
00056 
00057 /* I2C PDMANACK mask                                                                                        */
00058 #define CR_PDMANACK_SET          ((u32)0x00000400)
00059 #define CR_PDMANACK_RESET        ((u32)0xFFFFFBFF)
00060 
00061 /* I2C ENTOUT mask                                                                                          */
00062 #define CR_ENTOUT_SET            ((u32)0x00001000)
00063 #define CR_ENTOUT_RESET          ((u32)0xFFFFEFFF)
00064 
00065 /* I2C COMBFILT mask                                                                                        */
00066 #define CR_COMBFILTER_SET        ((u32)0x00002000)
00067 #define CR_COMBFILTER_RESET      ((u32)0xFFFFDFFF)
00068 
00069 /* I2C Device Address 0 and Device Address 1 mask                                                           */
00070 #define ADDR_DEVADDR0_SET        ((u32)0x00008000)
00071 #define ADDR_DEVADDR0_RESET      ((u32)0xFFFF7FFF)
00072 #define ADDR_DEVADDR1_SET        ((u32)0x80000000)
00073 #define ADDR_DEVADDR1_RESET      ((u32)0x7FFFFFFF)
00074 
00075 /**
00076   * @}
00077   */
00078 
00079 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00080 /** @defgroup I2C_Exported_Functions I2C exported functions
00081   * @{
00082   */
00083 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00084  * @brief Deinitialize the I2C peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00085  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00086  * @retval None
00087  ************************************************************************************************************/
00088 void I2C_DeInit(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx)
00089 {
00090   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00091 
00092   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00093   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00094 
00095   if (I2Cx == HT_I2C0)
00096   {
00097     RSTCUReset.Bit.I2C0 = 1;
00098   }
00099   #if (LIBCFG_I2C1)
00100   else if (I2Cx == HT_I2C1)
00101   {
00102     RSTCUReset.Bit.I2C1 = 1;
00103   }
00104   #endif
00105   #if (LIBCFG_I2C2)
00106   else if (I2Cx == HT_I2C2)
00107   {
00108     RSTCUReset.Bit.I2C2 = 1;
00109   }
00110   #endif
00111 
00112   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00113 }
00114 
00115 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00116  * @brief Initialize the I2Cx peripheral according to the specified parameters in the I2C_InitStruct.
00117  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00118  * @param I2C_InitStruct: pointer to a I2C_InitTypeDef structure.
00119  * @retval None
00120  ************************************************************************************************************/
00121 void I2C_Init(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, I2C_InitTypeDef* I2C_InitStruct)
00122 {
00123   u32 PCLK_Freq = 0;
00124   s32 sTmp = 0;
00125   s32 SHPGR = 0;
00126   s32 SLPGR = 0;
00127 
00128   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00129   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00130   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_GENERAL_CALL(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_GeneralCall));
00131   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ACKNOWLEDGE_ADDRESS(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_AddressingMode));
00132   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ACKNOWLEDGE(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Acknowledge));
00133   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ADDRESS(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_OwnAddress));
00134   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_SPEED(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Speed));
00135 
00136   #if (LIBCFG_I2C_NO_10BIT_MODE)
00137   I2Cx->CR = (I2Cx->CR & 0xFFFFFFFA) | I2C_InitStruct->I2C_GeneralCall | I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Acknowledge;
00138   #else
00139   I2Cx->CR = (I2Cx->CR & 0xFFFFFF7A) | I2C_InitStruct->I2C_GeneralCall |
00140              I2C_InitStruct->I2C_AddressingMode | I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Acknowledge;
00141   #endif
00142 
00143   #if (LIBCFG_I2C_TWO_DEV_ADDR)
00144   I2Cx->ADDR = (I2Cx->ADDR & 0xFFFF0000) | (ADDR_DEVADDR0_SET | (I2C_InitStruct->I2C_OwnAddress));
00145   #else
00146   I2Cx->ADDR = I2C_InitStruct->I2C_OwnAddress;
00147   #endif
00148 
00149   if (I2Cx == HT_I2C0)
00150     PCLK_Freq = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_I2C0);
00151   #if (LIBCFG_I2C1)
00152   else if (I2Cx == HT_I2C1)
00153     PCLK_Freq = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_I2C1);
00154   #endif
00155   #if (LIBCFG_I2C2)
00156   else if (I2Cx == HT_I2C2)
00157     PCLK_Freq = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_I2C2);
00158   #endif
00159 
00160   switch (I2Cx->CR & 0xC000)
00161   {
00162     case 0:
00163     {
00164       sTmp = 6;
00165       break;
00166     }
00167     case 0x4000:
00168     {
00169       sTmp = 8;
00170       break;
00171     }
00172     case 0x8000:
00173     {
00174       sTmp = 9;
00175       break;
00176     }
00177   }
00178 
00179   SHPGR = (PCLK_Freq * 9)/(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Speed * 20) - sTmp - I2C_InitStruct->I2C_SpeedOffset;
00180   SLPGR = (PCLK_Freq * 11)/(I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Speed * 20) - sTmp - I2C_InitStruct->I2C_SpeedOffset;
00181 
00182   SHPGR = (SHPGR < 0) ? 0 : SHPGR;
00183   SLPGR = (SLPGR < 0) ? 0 : SLPGR;
00184 
00185   I2Cx->SHPGR = SHPGR;
00186   I2Cx->SLPGR = SLPGR;
00187 }
00188 
00189 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00190  * @brief Fill each I2C_InitStruct member with its default value.
00191  * @param I2C_InitStruct: pointer to an I2C_InitTypeDef structure.
00192  * @retval None
00193  ************************************************************************************************************/
00194 void I2C_StructInit(I2C_InitTypeDef* I2C_InitStruct)
00195 {
00196   I2C_InitStruct->I2C_GeneralCall = I2C_GENERALCALL_DISABLE;
00197   I2C_InitStruct->I2C_AddressingMode = I2C_ADDRESSING_7BIT;
00198   I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Acknowledge = I2C_ACK_DISABLE;
00199   I2C_InitStruct->I2C_OwnAddress = 0;
00200   I2C_InitStruct->I2C_Speed = 1000000;
00201   I2C_InitStruct->I2C_SpeedOffset = 0;
00202 }
00203 
00204 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00205  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified I2C peripheral.
00206  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00207  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00208  * @retval None
00209  ************************************************************************************************************/
00210 void I2C_Cmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, ControlStatus NewState)
00211 {
00212   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00213   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00214   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00215 
00216   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00217   {
00218     I2Cx->CR |= CR_ENI2C_SET;
00219   }
00220   else
00221   {
00222     I2Cx->CR &= CR_ENI2C_RESET;
00223   }
00224 }
00225 
00226 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00227  * @brief Generate STOP condition of I2C communication.
00228  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00229  * @retval None
00230  ************************************************************************************************************/
00231 void I2C_GenerateSTOP(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx)
00232 {
00233   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00234   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00235 
00236   I2Cx->CR |= 0x2;
00237 }
00238 
00239 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00240  * @brief Enable or Disable I2C interrupts.
00241  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00242  * @param I2C_Int: specify if the I2C interrupt source to be enabled or disabled.
00243  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00244  *     @arg I2C_INT_STA
00245  *     @arg I2C_INT_STO
00246  *     @arg I2C_INT_ADRS
00247  *     @arg I2C_INT_GCS
00248  *     @arg I2C_INT_ARBLOS
00249  *     @arg I2C_INT_RXNACK
00250  *     @arg I2C_INT_BUSERR
00251  *     @arg I2C_INT_TOUT
00252  *     @arg I2C_INT_RXDNE
00253  *     @arg I2C_INT_TXDE
00254  *     @arg I2C_INT_RXBF
00255  *     @arg I2C_INT_ALL
00256  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00257  * @retval None
00258  ************************************************************************************************************/
00259 void I2C_IntConfig(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Int, ControlStatus NewState)
00260 {
00261   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00262   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00263   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_INT(I2C_Int));
00264   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00265 
00266   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00267   {
00268     I2Cx->IER |= I2C_Int;
00269   }
00270    else
00271   {
00272     I2Cx->IER &= (u32)~I2C_Int;
00273   }
00274 }
00275 
00276 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00277  * @brief Enable or Disable I2C General Call.
00278  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00279  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00280  * @retval None
00281  ************************************************************************************************************/
00282 void I2C_GeneralCallCmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, ControlStatus NewState)
00283 {
00284   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00285   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00286   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00287 
00288   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00289   {
00290     I2Cx->CR |= CR_ENGC_SET;
00291   }
00292   else
00293   {
00294     I2Cx->CR &= CR_ENGC_RESET;
00295   }
00296 }
00297 
00298 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00299  * @brief Enable or Disable I2C sending acknowledgement.
00300  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00301  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00302  * @retval None
00303  ************************************************************************************************************/
00304 void I2C_AckCmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, ControlStatus NewState)
00305 {
00306   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00307   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00308   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00309 
00310   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00311   {
00312     I2Cx->CR |= CR_ACK_SET;
00313   }
00314   else
00315   {
00316     I2Cx->CR &= CR_ACK_RESET;
00317   }
00318 }

00320 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00321  * @brief Configure own address of the specified I2C.
00322  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00323  * @param I2C_Address: specify own address of I2C.
00324  * @retval None
00325  ************************************************************************************************************/
00326 void I2C_SetOwnAddress(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, I2C_AddressTypeDef I2C_Address)
00327 {
00328   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00329   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00330   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ADDRESS(I2C_Address));
00331 
00332   #if (LIBCFG_I2C_TWO_DEV_ADDR)
00333   I2Cx->ADDR = (I2Cx->ADDR & 0xFFFFFF80) | (ADDR_DEVADDR0_SET | I2C_Address);
00334   #else
00335   I2Cx->ADDR = I2C_Address;
00336   #endif
00337 }
00338 
00339 #if (LIBCFG_I2C_TWO_DEV_ADDR)
00340 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00341  * @brief Configure own address 1 of the specified I2C.
00342  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00343  * @param I2C_Address: specify own address 1 of I2C.
00344  * @retval None
00345  ************************************************************************************************************/
00346 void I2C_SetOwnAddress1(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, I2C_AddressTypeDef I2C_Address)
00347 {
00348   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00349   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00350   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ADDRESS(I2C_Address));
00351 
00352   I2Cx->ADDR = (I2Cx->ADDR & 0xFF80FFFF) | (ADDR_DEVADDR1_SET | (I2C_Address << 16));
00353 }
00354 
00355 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00356  * @brief Enable or Disable I2C own address.
00357  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00358  * @param Address: specify the ADDR number.
00359  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00360  *     @arg I2C_DEV_ADDR_0 :
00361  *     @arg I2C_DEV_ADDR_1 :
00362  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00363  * @retval None
00364  ************************************************************************************************************/
00365 void I2C_OwnAddressCmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, I2C_ADDR_Enum Address, ControlStatus NewState)
00366 {
00367   u32 value = ADDR_DEVADDR0_SET;
00368 
00369   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00370   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00371   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ADDR(Address));
00372   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00373 
00374   if (Address == I2C_DEV_ADDR_1)
00375   {
00376     value = value << 16;
00377   }
00378   
00379   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00380   {
00381     I2Cx->ADDR |= value;
00382   }
00383   else
00384   {
00385     I2Cx->ADDR &= (~value);
00386   }
00387 }
00388 #endif
00389 
00390 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00391  * @brief Start transmitting to target slave address.
00392  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00393  * @param I2C_Address: specify the slave address which will be transmitted.
00394  * @param I2C_Direction: This parameter can be I2C_MASTER_READ or I2C_MASTER_WRITE.
00395  * @retval None
00396  ************************************************************************************************************/
00397 void I2C_TargetAddressConfig(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, I2C_AddressTypeDef I2C_Address, u32 I2C_Direction)
00398 {
00399   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00400   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00401   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ADDRESS(I2C_Address));
00402   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_DIRECTION(I2C_Direction));
00403 
00404   /* Make sure the prior stop command has been finished                                                     */
00405   while (I2Cx->CR & 0x2);
00406 
00407   if (I2C_Direction != I2C_MASTER_WRITE)
00408   {
00409     I2Cx->TAR = I2C_Address | I2C_MASTER_READ;
00410   }
00411    else
00412   {
00413     I2Cx->TAR = I2C_Address | I2C_MASTER_WRITE;
00414   }
00415 }
00416 
00417 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00418  * @brief Send a data word through the I2Cx peripheral.
00419  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00420  * @param I2C_Data: Byte to be transmitted.
00421  * @retval None
00422  ************************************************************************************************************/
00423 void I2C_SendData(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u8 I2C_Data)
00424 {
00425   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00426   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00427 
00428   I2Cx->DR = I2C_Data;
00429 }
00430 
00431 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00432  * @brief Return the received data by the I2Cx peripheral.
00433  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00434  * @retval The value of the received data.
00435  ************************************************************************************************************/
00436 u8 I2C_ReceiveData(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx)
00437 {
00438   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00439   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00440 
00441   return (u8)I2Cx->DR;
00442 }
00443 
00444 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00445  * @brief Read the specified I2C register and returns its value.
00446  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00447  * @param I2C_Register: specify the register to read.
00448  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00449  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_CR    : Control Register
00450  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_IER   : Interrupt Enable Register
00451  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_ADDR  : Address Register
00452  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_SR    : Status Register
00453  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_SHPGR : SCL High Period Generation Register
00454  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_SLPGR : SCL Low Period Generation Register
00455  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_DR    : Data Register
00456  *     @arg I2C_REGISTER_TAR   : Target Register
00457  * @retval None
00458  ************************************************************************************************************/
00459 u32 I2C_ReadRegister(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u8 I2C_Register)
00460 {
00461   vu32 tmp = 0;
00462 
00463   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00464   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00465   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_REGISTER(I2C_Register));
00466 
00467   tmp = (u32)I2Cx;
00468   tmp += I2C_Register;
00469   return (*(u32 *)tmp);
00470 }
00471 
00472 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00473  * @brief Check whether the specified I2C flag has been set.
00474  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00475  * @param I2C_Flag: specify the flag to be check.
00476  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00477  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_STA     : I2C start condition transmitted flag (Master mode)
00478  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_STO     : I2C stop condition detected flag (Slave flag)
00479  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_ADRS    : I2C address flag
00480  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_GCS     : I2C general call flag (Slave mode)
00481  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_ARBLOS  : I2C arbitration loss flag (Master mode)
00482  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_RXNACK  : I2C received not acknowledge flag
00483  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_BUSERR  : I2C bus error flag
00484  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_RXDNE   : I2C Rx data not empty flag
00485  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_TXDE    : I2C Tx data empty flag
00486  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_RXBF    : I2C RX buffer full flag
00487  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_BUSBUSY : I2C bus busy flag
00488  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_MASTER  : I2C master mode flag (Master flag)
00489  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_TXNRX   : I2C transmitter mode flag
00490  * @retval SET or RESET
00491  ************************************************************************************************************/
00492 FlagStatus I2C_GetFlagStatus(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Flag)
00493 {
00494   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00495   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00496   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_FLAG(I2C_Flag));
00497 
00498   if ((I2Cx->SR & I2C_Flag) != (u32)RESET)
00499   {
00500     return (SET);
00501   }
00502   else
00503   {
00504     return (RESET);
00505   }
00506 }
00507 
00508 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00509  * @brief Check whether the specified I2C status has been active.
00510  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00511  * @param I2C_Status: specify the flag that is to be check.
00512  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00513  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_SEND_START
00514  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_RECEIVER_MODE
00515  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_TRANSMITTER_MODE
00516  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_RX_NOT_EMPTY
00517  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_RX_NOT_EMPTY_NOBUSY
00518  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_TX_EMPTY
00519  *     @arg I2C_MASTER_RX_BUFFER_FULL
00520  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_ACK_TRANSMITTER_ADDRESS
00521  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_ACK_RECEIVER_ADDRESS
00522  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_ACK_GCALL_ADDRESS
00523  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_RX_NOT_EMPTY
00524  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_RX_NOT_EMPTY_STOP
00525  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_TX_EMPTY
00526  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_RX_BUFFER_FULL
00527  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_RECEIVED_NACK
00528  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_RECEIVED_NACK_STOP
00529  *     @arg I2C_SLAVE_STOP_DETECTED
00530  * @retval SUCCESS or ERROR
00531  ************************************************************************************************************/
00532 ErrStatus I2C_CheckStatus(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Status)
00533 {
00534   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00535   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00536   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_STATUS(I2C_Status));
00537 
00538   if (I2Cx->SR == I2C_Status)
00539   {
00540     return (SUCCESS);
00541   }
00542   else
00543   {
00544     return (ERROR);
00545   }
00546 }
00547 
00548 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00549  * @brief Clear the specified I2C flag.
00550  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00551  * @param I2C_Flag: specify the flag that is to be cleared.
00552  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00553  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_ARBLOS : I2C arbitration flag
00554  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_RXNACK : I2C receive not acknowledge flag
00555  *     @arg I2C_FLAG_BUSERR : I2C Bus error flag
00556  * @retval None
00557  ************************************************************************************************************/
00558 void I2C_ClearFlag(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Flag)
00559 {
00560   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00561   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00562   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_CLEAR_FLAG(I2C_Flag));
00563 
00564   I2Cx->SR = I2C_Flag;
00565 }
00566 
00567 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00568  * @brief Set the interval timing of the high period of the I2C clock.
00569  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00570  * @param I2C_HighPeriod: specify the high period that is to be set.
00571  *   This parameter must be a number between 0 and 0xFFFF.
00572  * @retval None
00573  ************************************************************************************************************/
00574 void I2C_SetSCLHighPeriod(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_HighPeriod)
00575 {
00576   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00577   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00578   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_SCL_HIGH(I2C_HighPeriod));
00579 
00580   I2Cx->SHPGR = I2C_HighPeriod;
00581 }
00582

00585  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00586  * @param I2C_LowPeriod: specify the low period that is to be set.
00587  *   This parameter must be a number between 0 and 0xFFFF.

00591 {

00594   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_SCL_LOW(I2C_LowPeriod));
00595 
00596   I2Cx->SLPGR = I2C_LowPeriod;
00597 }

00599 #if (LIBCFG_PDMA)
00600 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00601  * @brief Enable or Disable the I2Cx PDMA interface.
00602  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00603  * @param I2C_PDMAREQ: specify the I2C PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled.
00604  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00605  *     @arg I2C_PDMAREQ_TX: Tx PDMA transfer request
00606  *     @arg I2C_PDMAREQ_RX: Rx PDMA transfer request
00607  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00608  * @retval None
00609  ************************************************************************************************************/
00610 void I2C_PDMACmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_PDMAREQ, ControlStatus NewState)
00611 {
00612   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00613   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00614   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_PDMA_REQ(I2C_PDMAREQ));
00615   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00616 
00617   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00618   {
00619     I2Cx->CR |= I2C_PDMAREQ;
00620   }
00621   else
00622   {
00623     I2Cx->CR &= ~I2C_PDMAREQ;
00624   }
00625 }
00626 
00627 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00628  * @brief Specify that the next PDMA transfer is the last one.
00629  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00630  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00631  * @retval None
00632  ************************************************************************************************************/
00633 void I2C_PDMANACKCmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, ControlStatus NewState)
00634 {
00635   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00636   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00637   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00638 
00639   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00640   {
00641     I2Cx->CR |= CR_PDMANACK_SET;
00642   }
00643   else
00644   {
00645     I2Cx->CR &= CR_PDMANACK_RESET;
00646   }
00647 }
00648 #endif
00649 
00650 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00651  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified I2C time out function.
00652  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00653  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00654  * @retval None
00655  ************************************************************************************************************/
00656 void I2C_TimeOutCmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, ControlStatus NewState)
00657 {
00658   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00659   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00660   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00661 
00662   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00663   {
00664     I2Cx->CR |= CR_ENTOUT_SET;
00665   }
00666   else
00667   {
00668     I2Cx->CR &= CR_ENTOUT_RESET;
00669   }
00670 }
00671 
00672 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00673  * @brief This function is used to set the I2C timeout value.
00674  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00675  * @param I2C_Timeout: specify the timeout value.
00676  * @retval None
00677  ************************************************************************************************************/
00678 void I2C_SetTimeOutValue(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Timeout)
00679 {
00680   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00681   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00682   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_TIMEOUT(I2C_Timeout));
00683 
00684   I2Cx->TOUT = (I2C_Timeout | (I2Cx->TOUT & 0xFFFF0000));
00685 }
00686 
00687 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00688  * @brief This function is used to set the prescaler of I2C timeout value.
00689  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00690  * @param I2C_Prescaler: specify the I2C time out prescaler value.
00691  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00692  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_1   : I2C prescaler set to 1
00693  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_2   : I2C prescaler set to 2
00694  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_4   : I2C prescaler set to 4
00695  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_16  : I2C prescaler set to 16
00696  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_32  : I2C prescaler set to 32
00697  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_64  : I2C prescaler set to 64
00698  *     @arg I2C_PRESCALER_128 : I2C prescaler set to 128
00699  * @retval None
00700  ************************************************************************************************************/
00701 void I2C_SetTimeOutPrescaler(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Prescaler)
00702 {
00703   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00704   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00705   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_PRESCALER(I2C_Prescaler));
00706 
00707   I2Cx->TOUT = (I2C_Prescaler | (I2Cx->TOUT & 0x0000FFFF));
00708 }
00709 
00710 #if (LIBCFG_I2C_NO_ADDR_MASK == 0)
00711 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00712  * @brief This function is used to determine the prescaler of I2C timeout value.
00713  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00714  * @param I2C_Mask: specify the bit position of I2C slave address to be masked.
00715  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00716  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_0 : Bit 0 of I2C slave address is masked
00717  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_1 : Bit 1 of I2C slave address is masked
00718  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_2 : Bit 2 of I2C slave address is masked
00719  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_3 : Bit 3 of I2C slave address is masked
00720  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_4 : Bit 4 of I2C slave address is masked
00721  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_5 : Bit 5 of I2C slave address is masked
00722  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_6 : Bit 6 of I2C slave address is masked
00723  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_7 : Bit 7 of I2C slave address is masked
00724  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_8 : Bit 8 of I2C slave address is masked
00725  *     @arg I2C_MASKBIT_9 : Bit 9 of I2C slave address is masked
00726  * @retval None
00727  ************************************************************************************************************/
00728 void I2C_AddressMaskConfig(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 I2C_Mask)
00729 {
00730   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00731   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00732   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_ADDRESS_MASK(I2C_Mask));
00733 
00734   I2Cx->ADDMR = I2C_Mask;
00735 }
00736 #endif
00737 
00738 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00739  * @brief Return the received address by the I2Cx peripheral.
00740  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00741  * @retval The value of the received address.
00742  ************************************************************************************************************/
00743 u16 I2C_GetAddressBuffer(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx)
00744 {
00745   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00746   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00747 
00748   return ((u16)I2Cx->ADDSR);
00749 }
00750 
00751 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00752  * @brief Enable or Disable the combinational filter.
00753  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00754  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00755  * @retval None
00756  ************************************************************************************************************/
00757 void I2C_CombFilterCmd(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, ControlStatus NewState)
00758 {
00759   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00760   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00761   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00762 
00763   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00764   {
00765     I2Cx->CR |= CR_COMBFILTER_SET;
00766   }
00767   else
00768   {
00769     I2Cx->CR &= CR_COMBFILTER_RESET;
00770   }
00771 }
00772 
00773 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00774  * @brief This function is used to determine the filter glitch width of 0~2 PCLK.
00775  * @param I2Cx: where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
00776  * @param Seq_Filter_Select: specify the glitch width of 0~2 PCLK.
00777  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00778  *     @arg SEQ_FILTER_DISABLE : sequential filter is disabled
00779  *     @arg SEQ_FILTER_1_PCLK  : filter glitch width of 1 PCLK
00780  *     @arg SEQ_FILTER_2_PCLK  : filter glitch width of 2 PCLK
00781  * @retval None
00782  ************************************************************************************************************/
00783 void I2C_SequentialFilterConfig(HT_I2C_TypeDef* I2Cx, u32 Seq_Filter_Select)
00784 {
00785   u32 SHPGR = I2Cx->SHPGR;
00786   u32 SLPGR = I2Cx->SLPGR;
00787 
00788   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00789   Assert_Param(IS_I2C(I2Cx));
00790   Assert_Param(IS_I2C_SEQ_FILTER_MASK(Seq_Filter_Select));
00791 
00792   switch (I2Cx->CR & 0xC000)
00793   {
00794     case 0:
00795       if (Seq_Filter_Select == SEQ_FILTER_1_PCLK)
00796       {
00797         if (SHPGR >= 2)
00798         {
00799           SHPGR -= 2;
00800           SLPGR -= 2;
00801         }
00802       }
00803       else if (Seq_Filter_Select == SEQ_FILTER_2_PCLK)
00804       {
00805         if (SHPGR >= 2)
00806         {
00807           SHPGR -= 3;
00808           SLPGR -= 3;
00809         }
00810       }
00811       break;
00812 
00813     case 0x4000:
00814       if (Seq_Filter_Select == SEQ_FILTER_DISABLE)
00815       {
00816         SHPGR += 2;
00817         SLPGR += 2;
00818       }
00819       else if (Seq_Filter_Select == SEQ_FILTER_2_PCLK)
00820       {
00821         if (SHPGR >= 1)
00822         {
00823           SHPGR -= 1;
00824           SLPGR -= 1;
00825         }
00826       }
00827       break;
00828 
00829     case 0x8000:
00830       if (Seq_Filter_Select == SEQ_FILTER_DISABLE)
00831       {
00832         SHPGR += 3;
00833         SLPGR += 3;
00834       }
00835       else if (Seq_Filter_Select == SEQ_FILTER_1_PCLK)
00836       {
00837         SHPGR += 1;
00838         SLPGR += 1;
00839       }
00840       break;
00841 
00842     default:
00843       break;
00844   }
00845 
00846   I2Cx->SHPGR = SHPGR;
00847   I2Cx->SLPGR = SLPGR;
00848   I2Cx->CR = (I2Cx->CR & 0x3FFF) | Seq_Filter_Select;
00849 }
00850 /**
00851   * @}
00852   */
00853 
00854 
00855 /**
00856   * @}
00857   */
00858 
00859 /**
00860   * @}
00861   */
